title: Hint
text:
1) We start with the given polar equation:
$$r$$ $$=$$ $$1$$ / (5 - $$5$$ sin(θ)) $$=$$ $$1$$ / [5(1 - sin(θ))].

2) Multiply both sides by 5(1 - sin(θ)):
$$r$$ * 5(1 - sin(θ)) $$=$$ $$1$$
⇒ $$5r$$ - $$5r$$ sin(θ) $$=$$ $$1$$.

3) Recall that sin(θ) $$=$$ $$ rac{y}{r}$$ in Cartesian coordinates (where $$x$$ $$=$$ $$r$$ cos(θ), $$y$$ $$=$$ $$r$$ sin(θ)), and $$r$$ $$=$$ √(x² + y²). Substitute sin(θ) $$=$$ $$ rac{y}{r}$$ into the equation:
$$5r$$ - $$5r$$ $$ rac{y}{r}$$ $$=$$ $$1$$
⇒ $$5r$$ - $$5y$$ $$=$$ $$1$$
⇒ 5√(x² + y²) - $$5y$$ $$=$$ $$1$$
⇒ 5√(x² + y²) $$=$$ $$1$$ + $$5y$$
⇒ √(x² + y²) $$=$$ (1 + 5y)/5 $$=$$ $$ rac{1}{5}$$ + $$y$$.

4) Square both sides to eliminate the square root:
x² + y² $$=$$ (1/5 + y)²
⇒ x² + y² $$=$$ $$ rac{1}{25}$$ + $$ rac{2y}{5}$$ + y²
⇒ x² $$=$$ $$ rac{1}{25}$$ + $$ rac{2y}{5}$$.

5) Multiply through by $$25$$ to clear the fractions:
...
